title: Escorts Kubota shares jump 2.05% amid high volume in today's session
content: Shares of Escorts Kubota gained 2.05% to trade at Rs 3,479.20 in Tuesday's session, driven by high trading volume and positive investor sentiment. This increase marks a notable movement for the stock, which is part of the Nifty Midcap 150 index. This comes as the stock witnessed high volume, volume surge and unusual volume. title: Subscribe for Aditya Infotech Ltd IPO; Anand Rathi
content: Anand Rathi, Aditya Infotech Ltd Aditya Infotech Limited offers a comprehensive range of advanced video security and surveillance products, technologies, and solutions for both enterprise and consumer segments under their well-recognized ‘CP PLUS’ brand. Additionally, they provide solutions and services such as fully integrated security systems and Security-as-a-Service, delivered directly and through their distribution network, catering to endcustomers across various sectors including banking, insurance, real estate, healthcare, industrial, defence, education, hospitality, manufacturing, retail, and law enforcement. Their business is primarily divided into: (i) manufacturing and trading activities; and (ii) trading activities. The manufacturing and trading segment includes the production and sale of CP PLUS products along with after-sales services, while the trading activities involve distribution of Dahua products. They were assigned the ‘CP PLUS’ brand in 2014 with the objective of expanding access to cost-effective security and surveillance products, solutions, and services. Valuation and Outlook At the upper price band, the company is valued at a FY25 P/E of 22.5x, with a post-issue market capitalization of ₹79,118.9 million. The company holds a dominant position in the segment with minimal competition and has consistently reported growth in both revenue and profitability over the stated periods. Given these strengths, the IPO appears fully priced, and a “SUBSCRIBE – LONG TERM” recommendation is advised. For all IPO report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Aditya Infotech -290725 - anand

title: Mazagon Dock shares among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150

title: Hold Jio Financial Services; target of Rs 325: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Jio Financial Services In Q1FY26, the Net Interest Income (NII) stood grew by 63.3% YoY (-1.5% QoQ) to INR 2,641 Mn., led by huge scale-up of NBC operations. Sequentially NII stood flat, led by higher finance costs on account of increased external borrowings. Total operating income grew by 24.6% YoY (1.9% QoQ) to INR 5,207 Mn, majorly led by increase in net interest income. Pre-Provision Operating Profit (PPoP) grew by 8.0% YoY (-2.1% QoQ) to INR 3,659 Mn., led by stronger momentum in NII growth driven by sharp ramp-up in AUM. Net profit grew by 3.8% YoY (+2.7% QoQ) to INR 3,247 Mn., led by improved operational performance. Net profit was positively impacted by a one-off gain of INR 286 Mn., Adjusted net profit declined by 5.3% YoY (-6.3% QoQ) to INR 2,961 Mn. Outlook We value JFSL at a 1.8x Q1FY26 ABV (considering a 20.0% Holdco discount) to arrive at a revised target price of INR 325 per share. We reiterate our “HOLD” rating on the stock. For all recommendations report, click here Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts/broking houses/rating agencies on moneycontrol.com are their own, and not that of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions. Jio Financial Services - 29072025 - deven

title: Accumulate CreditAccess Grameen; target of Rs 1400: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on CreditAccess Grameen Net Interest Income (NII) for Q1FY26 declined by 1.6% YoY (+7.0% QoQ) to INR 9,370 Mn, in-line with our estimates. The Net Interest Margin (NIM) for Q1FY26 increased by 10bps sequentially to 12.8%, led by decline in cost of borrowings, partially offset marginal decline in portfolio yield. Pre-Provisioning Operating Profit (PPoP) declined by 7.9% YoY (+3.0% QoQ) to INR 6,340 Mn., in-line with our estimates. Provisions stood at INR 5,719 Mn. (+227.6% YoY/ -1.9% QoQ), to maintain the asset quality. Net profit declined by 84.9% YoY (+27.5% QoQ) to INR 602 Mn., sharply below our estimates led by elevated credit costs and continued write-offs. Outlook We reiterate our “ACCUMULATE” rating on the stock, despite factoring of muted earnings in the short-term led by elevated write-offs and declining loan book in the H1FY26. We expect a sharper decline in write-offs, and strong growth momentum in loan book H2FY26 onwards, which should drive re-rating of the stock. title: Accumulate Persistent Systems; target of Rs 5790: Deven Choksey
content: Deven Choksey's research report on Persistent Systems Persistent Systems Q1FY26 revenue came in at INR 33,336 Mn, up 21.8% YoY (+2.8% QoQ), in-line with our estimates, primarily driven by robust performance in the BFSI segment, with incremental contributions from Software, HiTech, and Emerging Markets verticals, partially offset by softness in healthcare and Life Sciences. In CC terms, it delivered a growth of 3.3% sequentially (vs 4.5% in Q4FY25). In USD terms, revenue stood at 389.7 Mn, up 18.8% YoY (+3.9% YoY). Outlook We have rolled forward our valuation basis to Jun’27 estimates. We value Persistent Systems at 40.0x Jun’27 EPS, implying a target price of INR 5,790. We upgrade our rating from “HOLD” to “ACCUMULATE” on the stock. content: Shares of Bharat Electronics declined 2.16% to Rs 380.85 in Tuesday's trading session, making it one of the top losers on the Nifty 50. Other notable losers on the Nifty 50 included Eternal, NTPC, SBI Life Insura, and Bajaj Finserv. At 10:30 am, the Nifty 50 index was trading with negative bias. Net profit for the same period was Rs 960.67 Crore, up from Rs 780.99 Crore year-over-year. Earnings per share (EPS) increased to Rs 1.33 in June 2025 from Rs 1.08 in June 2024. Annual Results: For the year-ending March 2025, revenue reached Rs 23,768.75 Crore, a notable increase from Rs 20,268.24 Crore in 2024. title: Q1 Results impact: Mazagon Dock shares plunge 5%; Paradeep Phosphates, Waaree Energies rally up to 14%
content: The shares of Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders plunged more than 5 percent on July 29 after the company's Q1 results dampened investor sentiment. Paradeep Phosphates and Waaree Energies shares meanwhile recorded strong gains. Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders dropped over 5 percent to hit an intraday low of Rs 2,646 apiece in the morning. Waaree Energies shares meanwhile gained over 5 percent to trade at Rs 3,274 apiece. Paradeep Phosphates shares rallied 14 percent to hit a fresh 52-week high of Rs 227 apiece. Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders Q1 Results: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders on July 28 reported a net profit of Rs 452 crore for the first quarter of the financial year 2026. This marks a decline of around 35 percent on-year from the Rs 696 crore net profit reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year. Sequentially, the firm's net profit rose nearly 39 percent quarter-on-quarter from the Rs 325 crore reported in Q4 FY25. While net profit declined annually, the firm’s revenue from operations rose over than 11 percent on-year to Rs 2,626 crore in Q1 FY26. Revenue from operations however fell more than 17 percent sequentially. Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares have dropped nearly 8 percent in the past five days, and over 17 percent in the past one month. The stock has however gained more than 14 percent in the past six months, and nearly 20 percent in 2025 so far. Waaree Energies Q1 Results: Waaree Energies on July 28 reported a consolidated net profit of Rs 745 crore for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. This marks a 89 percent on-year jump from the Rs 394 crore consolidated net profit reported in the year-ago period. The firm's revenue from operations rose 30 percent on-year to Rs 4,426 crore in Q1FY26 as against Rs 3,409 crore in Q1FY25. Further, the company's board approved capex of Rs 2,754 crore to set up two plants. Waaree Energies shares have gained nearly 3 percent in the past one month, and over 46 percent in the past six months. The stock has gained around 13 percent in 2025 so far. Paradeep Phosphates Q1 Results: Paradeep Phosphates on July 28 reported a net profit of Rs 256 crore for Q1 FY26. This marks a whopping 4,656 percent on-year rise from the Rs 5.38 crore net profit reported in the corresponding quarter of the previous financial year. Its revenue from operations meanwhile rose around 58 percent on-year to Rs 3,754 crore in the April June quarter of financial year 2026. The company had earlier reported revenue from operations at Rs 2,377 crore in the year-ago period. Paradeep Phosphates shares have rallied nearly 19 percent in the past five days, and over 42 percent in the past one month. The stock has more than doubled in share value in 2025 so far, after a 170 percent rally in the past one year. Also read: Our LIVE blog on stock market updates

title: Hold Petronet LNG; target of Rs 311: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Petronet LNG Total volume stood at 220TBtu (Ple 205 TBtu, -16% YoY, +7% QoQ). However, the company took an impairment of Rs1.4bn during the quarter on account of take-or-pay. As a result, despite higher-than-estimated volume, the company reported an in-line EBITDA of Rs11.6bn (Ple Rs11.9bn, BBGe Rs12.6bn, -26% YoY, -23.3% QoQ). PAT came in at Rs8.5bn (Ple Rs8.1bn, BBGe Rs9bn, -25% YoY, - 20.5% QoQ). Concerns remain on utilization of its assets amidst rising competition, especially from the recently commissioned Chhara LNG terminal and completion of breakwater facility at Dabhol LNG terminal. Ongoing capex on petrochemical project is also expected to be ROCE dilutive. Outlook We value the stock at Rs311 (previous Target Price Rs315), based on 10x (unchanged) FY27 EPS. Due to the decline in the stock price, we upgrade from ‘Reduce’ to ‘Hold’. title: Hold Shriram Finance; target of Rs 650: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Shriram Finance Q1FY26 AUM grew 16.6% YoY to Rs 2,722.5 bn, led by strong growth in the PV, 2W, MSME and Farm Equipment portfolio. NII saw a lukewarm growth of 10% YoY impacted by negative carry from excess liquidity; however CoF has started to reduce and we expect NIM to improve in FY26. While credit cost was controlled (at 2.1%), Stage 2 increased by 40 bps QoQ. We remain conservative and build a higher credit cost of 2.1% for FY26E (vs. guidance of <2%). We marginally tweak our FY26/ FY27 estimates and expect SHFL to deliver RoA/ RoE of 3.3%/ 17.0% in FY27E, led by steady growth in AUM, favourable margin profile and controlled asset quality ratios. Outlook We slightly cut our multiple to 1.8x on Mar’27 ABV (vs. 1.9x earlier) with a TP of Rs 650. Maintain HOLD. title: Buy Kotak Mahindra Bank; target of Rs 2350: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Kotak Mahindra Bank KMB saw a weak quarter as miss on provisions, fees and NII led to 13.7% lower core PAT. While NII was cushioned as cash was utilized to pay-off borrowings, Q2FY26 would see impact of normal liquidity and 50bps repo cut suggesting NIM decline QoQ. However, H2FY26 NIM could improve due to CRR cut and deposit repricing. While loan growth was healthy at 4.2% QoQ, it was led by SME and mid-market. Barring housing, retail growth was sluggish due to weak demand while unsecured recovery is slower. Hence, we trim loan growth by 100bps for FY26/27E to 16% YoY. Asset quality worsened QoQ due to higher net slippages/provisions led by MFI stress and slower corporate recovery. Outlook We cut NIM & fees, increase provisions but reduce opex; net cut in core PAT for FY26/27E is avg. 4.2% We tweak multiple to 2.3x from 2.4x on Mar’27 core ABV and slightly reduce TP to Rs2,350 from Rs2,400. Retain ‘BUY’. title: Buy Titan Company; target of Rs 3830: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Titan Company The acquisition of Damas will enable TTAN to consolidate its presence in USD15bn GCC jewellery market with brands like Damas, Tanishq and Gaia. TTAN will be paying an EV of AED 1038mn, which will be funded through a debt of Rs12bn and small funding from reserves. Damas has debt of ~700mn AED and working capital is funded by gold metal loan. TTAN plans to close stores catering to Se Asian population with gold jewellery and convert many of these into Tanishq stores. 3 Graff stores (20% of sales) are not a part of this transaction while 110 signature stores will be scaled up. 2025 will be the year of re-structuring and the transaction will be EPS dilutive in CY26. It will be EPS neutral in CY27 and will be EPS accretive only in CY28. This acquisition provides Titan plans to leverage its expertise in sourcing, inventory management, and customer acquisition to drive backend and technological efficiencies which along with superior gross margin, and improved product mix will drive margins higher. Outlook At current sales of Rs26.3bn (ex of Graff), DAMAS EV/Sales multiple stands at 0.95x, which is in-line with most global retailers. We believe, Damas acquisition will add value over next 3-4 years and does not add any upside in the near to medium term. TTAN will continue to drive strong growth in domestic market given benign base and benefits of strong brand and distribution. We reiterate Buy on Titan with TP of Rs3830. title: Hold Grindwell Norton; target of Rs 1739: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Grindwell Norton Grindwell Norton (GWN) delivered a subdued performance for the quarter, with revenue remaining largely flat YoY at Rs7.0bn and EBITDA margin contracting by 40bps YoY to 18.5%. The Abrasives segment reported negligible growth, while margins weakened further—likely impacted by continued Chinese dumping. The Ceramics & Plastics (C&P) segment also posted a decline in revenue, with profitability remaining under strain. Notably, the Digital Services segment saw topline growth, however, it continued to witness a sharp erosion in margins. Meanwhile, the management has approved a land acquisition of ~Rs180mn in Halol, Gujarat, on a freehold basis to support future expansion plans following the ongoing capacity expansion of the Halol plant for performance ceramics and refractories business. Outlook The stock is trading at a P/E of 43.7x/37.6x on FY26/27E earnings. We maintain ‘HOLD’ rating with a TP of Rs1,739 (same as earlier) valuing the stock at a PE of 40x Mar’27E (same as earlier). title: Accumulate Mphasis; target of Rs 2920: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Mphasis The revenue growth performance (+1.0% QoQ CC) was tad below our estimates (+1.4% QoQ CC), attributed to L&T business (down 46% QoQ) due to client-specific investments, which largely got offset through continued momentum in other parts of the portfolio. More importantly, the Direct business stood on a strong footing, grew 1.6% QoQ CC, led by BFS (+8.1% QoQ) and Insurance (+21.0% QoQ). The record high deal TCV of USD760m (80%+ New Gen) aided by four large deal wins in Q1 of three 100m+ TCV and one 50m+ TCV. Despite having recorded notable large wins in Q1, the deal funnel still looks encouraging (84% YoY). BFS and non-BFS pipelines are up 47% YoY and 108% YoY, respectively. We believe the company’s strong participation in AI-led transformation (68% AI-led deal pipeline) and taking ownership of client budgets through inevitable AI investments, partly de-risk the discretionary churn. The consistent increase in large deal wins and steady conversion rate (TCV to Revenue), which is missing in many of its peers, gives us confidence to stay positive on Mphasis. Outlook We are baking revenue growth of 6.2%/8.0% YoY CC with EBIT margin of 15.5%/15.7% for FY26E/FY27E. We are assigning 26x to FY27 EPS, translating a TP of 2,920. Upgrade to ACCUMULATE (HOLD earlier). title: Buy Cipla; target of Rs 1730: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Cipla CIPLA’s Q1FY26 EBITDA (Rs17.8bn; 25.6% OPM) was 6% ahead of our estimates. Cipla managed to deliver strong margins during the quarter. During the quarter company witnessed price erosion for its generic products which was offset by new launches such as gAbraxane. Mgmt guided strong US revenues of $1bn for FY27 despite gRevlimid erosion. We expect Cipla to maintain its existing US sales run-rate. This will be aided by several high value niche launches in the US like gAbraxane, Nilotininb, gAdvair. Further, Cipla’s strong net cash position of +$1.5bn provides flexibility to pursue strategic M&A opportunities. Our FY26E/27E EPS broadly remain unchanged. At CMP, stock is trading 23x FY26E EPS. Outlook We maintain our ‘BUY’ with TP of Rs1,730/share. Timely launch of critical high-value products in the US in FY26E/27E will be key. title: Buy Bank of Baroda; target of Rs 270: Prabhudas Lilladher
content: Prabhudas Lilladher's research report on Bank of Baroda BOB saw a weak quarter yet again as core PPoP adjusted for IT refund was 12.4% lower to PLe due to (1) miss on NIM by 8bps led by softer reported yields on loans and investments (2) weaker fee income and (3) higher opex led by other opex. Fall in reported NIM at 6-7bps QoQ was lower to peers (11-18bps decline). NIM may remain under pressure in Q2FY26 due to lead-lag impact of repo rate cut on loans/deposits. However, bank expects 70% of deposits to reprice within 1-2 quarters suggesting that NIM would start improving since Q3FY26. Loans de-grew by 2.0% QoQ due to 10% fall in corporate; however, BOB expects corporate growth of 8-10% YoY for FY26; we are factoring overall loan growth of 11% YoY in FY26. Outlook We trim NIM for FY26/27E by 5/3bps which may result in core earnings cut of 6.5%. We keep multiple at 0.9x on Mar’27 ABV but tweak TP to Rs270 from Rs275. Retain ‘BUY’. title: Ather Energy ties up with government to strengthen EV manufacturing ecosystem
content: Electric vehicle maker Ather Energy has signed an MoU with the Commerce Ministry to speed up growth in clean mobility and advanced manufacturing, as part of the Build in Bharat initiative led by Startup Policy Forum (SPF), a government statement said on July 29. Shares of Ather Energy were off lows in a quiet session of trade, higher by close to a percent. Since its listing in May 2025, shares of Ather are higher by close to 14 percent. As part of the tie up, Ather Energy will focus on 'strategic mentorship' for deep-tech startups, along with infrastructure-related support for upcoming players in the EV value chain. The partnership will aim to accelerate the growth of clean mobility and advanced manufacturing sectors. Ather will conduct innovation programs along with DPIIT, co-hosted skill development, and participation in Startup Mahakumbh to encourage the development of the clean mobility ecosystem. Tarun Mehta, the co-founder and CEO of Ather Energy said, “We are happy to collaborate with DPIIT to strengthen support systems for hardware and deep-tech startups. With policy support and stronger industry participation, this initiative can help founders tackle core technology challenges and scale high-quality products from India.” The initiative is aimed at supporting India's transition towards sustainable transport and help create an enabling environment for manufacturing-focused startups. After the MoU, Sanjiv Singh DPIIT Joint Secretary said India's electric mobility space is entering a transformative phase. “Through this partnership with Ather Energy, we aim to catalyse the development of an enabling environment where startups can contribute meaningfully to EV manufacturing, battery innovation, and clean energy solutions,” Sanjiv Singh added. This collaboration opens up opportunities for EV startups by supporting a future-ready, self-reliant ecosystem aligned with climate goals and manufacturing-driven aspirations. Shweta Rajpal Kohli, President and CEO, Startup Policy Forum said the partnership is vital for SPFs 'Build in Bharat' initiative, and unlocks the potential of manufacturing through collaboration. Ather Energy narrowed its losses in the March quarter of FY25 to Rs 234.4 crore on strong demand for top-selling 'Rizta' family scooters. Indian EV makers are gradually preparing for a future without subsidies, as the Centre plans to phase out or reduce incentives for electric vehicles, transitioning from manufacturing sops to pricing and technology. Earlier this year, Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal had said that India's EVs do not need fresh incentives. “India’s electric mobility segment is ready and set to fly. There is no need for new incentives as the existing ones are sufficient to kick-start the ecosystem,” Goyal said in January 2025.

title: Nifty Top Gainers: JSW Steel, IndusInd Bank stocks lead in early trading today
content: Indian markets opened on a positive note Tuesday, with certain stocks outperforming the broader market. Among the top gainers on the Nifty 50 were JSW Steel and IndusInd Bank shares, according to early trading data. At 09:25 am, JSW Steel was trading at Rs 1,044.90, a 1.56% increase from its previous close. IndusInd Bank followed closely, trading at Rs 814.50, up by 1.55%. Other notable gainers included Jio Financial (up 1.27%), ONGC (up 0.89%), and TATA Cons. Prod (up 0.83%). These stocks showed strong positive momentum as the market opened. Financial Snapshot: JSW Steel JSW Steel's financial performance shows a mixed trend. The consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 43,147 Crore, slightly increased from Rs 42,943 Crore in June 2024. However, net profit for the same quarter significantly increased to Rs 2,309 Crore from Rs 879 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also saw a substantial increase, reaching Rs 8.95 in June 2025 compared to Rs 3.47 in June 2024. The company's annual results reflect fluctuating revenues and profits. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 168,824 Crore, compared to Rs 175,006 Crore in the previous year. The net profit decreased to Rs 3,802 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 9,145 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also dropped to Rs 14.36 in 2025 from Rs 36.34 in 2024. Key financial indicators for JSW Steel are summarized below:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Jun 2024Rs 42,943.00 CroreRs 879.00 Crore3.47Jun 2025Rs 43,147.00 CroreRs 2,309.00 Crore8.952024Rs 175,006.00 CroreRs 9,145.00 Crore36.342025Rs 168,824.00 CroreRs 3,802.00 Crore14.36Financial Snapshot: ONGC ONGC's financial performance displays a robust profile in the energy sector. The consolidated revenue for the quarter ending March 2025 stood at Rs 170,811.73 Crore, increased from Rs 166,770.63 Crore in March 2024. However, net profit for the same quarter decreased to Rs 8,217.12 Crore from Rs 10,348.93 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also saw a decline, reaching Rs 5.82 in March 2025 compared to Rs 8.03 in March 2024. The annual results reflect strong revenues and profits. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 663,262.31 Crore, compared to Rs 591,447.12 Crore in the previous year. The net profit decreased to Rs 37,293.00 Crore in March 2025 from Rs 54,704.81 Crore in March 2024. The EPS also dropped to Rs 28.80 in 2025 from Rs 39.13 in 2024. Key financial indicators for ONGC are summarized below:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)Mar 2024Rs 166,770.63 CroreRs 10,348.93 Crore8.03Mar 2025Rs 170,811.73 CroreRs 8,217.12 Crore5.822024Rs 591,447.12 CroreRs 54,704.81 Crore39.132025Rs 663,262.31 CroreRs 37,293.00 Crore28.80Financial Snapshot: TATA Cons. Prod TATA Cons. Prod financial performance showcases steady growth. The consolidated revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 4,778.91 Crore, increased from Rs 4,352.07 Crore in June 2024. Similarly, the net profit for the same quarter increased to Rs 346.44 Crore from Rs 314.15 Crore in the previous year. The EPS also saw a slight increase, reaching Rs 3.38 in June 2025 compared to Rs 3.05 in June 2024. The annual results reflect consistent revenues and profits. The revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 17,618.30 Crore, compared to Rs 15,205.85 Crore in the previous year. title: Bharat Electronics shares decline 3% after Q1; CLSA maintains outperform rating
content: Shares of Bharat Electronics fell 3 percent to Rs 378 in morning trade on July 29 after the company's profit jumped 25 percent year-on-year, but witnessed a sequential decline. The state-run defence electronics firm reported a standalone net profit of Rs 969.13 crore for the quarter ended June 2025, up 25 percent from Rs 776.14 crore a year ago. Revenue from operations also edged higher by 5.2 percent to Rs 4,416.83 crore compared to Rs 4,198.77 crore in the same period last year. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates After the results, CLSA has maintained an outperform rating on Bharat Electronics Ltd with a target price of Rs 400, citing strong order momentum and robust margin performance. The brokerage noted that the slowdown in BEL's FY25 order backlog is now behind, with the company recording a 29 percent year-to-date growth in new orders. BEL is well-positioned to secure $7 billion worth of orders over the next 12 months—equivalent to 84 percent of its current backlog. CLSA highlighted that geopolitical tensions have prompted the government to fast-track 'Make in India' defence orders, and BEL has guided for a 44 percent jump in order inflows in FY26. Additionally, Q1 EBITDA margin expanded by 576 basis points year-on-year, surpassing the company's 27 percent guidance. Also read: P&G names longtime executive Shailesh Jejurikar to replace CEO However, on a quarter-on-quarter basis, BEL’s profit declined sharply, falling over 54 percent from the Rs 2,104.78 crore posted in the March 2025 quarter. On the consolidated front, the company’s net profit stood at Rs 969.05 crore, marking a 22.5 percent increase year-on-year. Consolidated revenue came in at Rs 4,439.74 crore, up 4.6 percent over the same period last year. BEL managed to rein in its expenses, which declined 2.13 percent year-on-year to Rs 3,291.21 crore. Total income in the quarter rose 3.5 percent to Rs 4,603.06 crore, up from Rs 4,447.15 crore in the year-ago period. The company’s order book remained robust, standing at Rs 74,859 crore as of July 1, 2025—providing strong visibility for future revenue. Read more: IndusInd Bank shares in focus after Q1; should you buy, sell or hold? At about 9:30 am, shares of the company were trading at Rs 384, lower by 1.4 percent from the last close on the NSE. Bharat Electronics' shares have risen 32 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Sensex down 100 pts, Nifty below 24,700 as IT stocks decline; smallcap index down for 9th straight day
content: Benchmark indices Nifty and Sensex were off to a flat-to-weak start on July 29, extending their fall for a third session in a row as global jitters and disappointing earnings weighed on sentiment. US markets ended mixed after a strong start, while Asian peers slipped. IT stocks led the decline, while the smallcap index slipped for a 9th session in a row. At about 9:30 am, the Sensex was down 117.96 points or 0.15 percent at 80,773.06, and the Nifty was down 17.55 points or 0.07 percent at 24,663.35. About 1317 shares advanced, 1062 shares declined, and 129 shares were unchanged. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates “The key overhang on markets right now is the uncertainty around the India-US trade deal, which hasn’t materialised yet,” said V K Vijayakumar, Chief Investment Strategist at Geojit Financial Services. “With the August 1 deadline approaching and time running out, the chances of a deal being struck are diminishing. President Trump’s successful negotiations with Japan and the EU—largely in America’s favour—could harden the US stance on India. We’ll have to wait and watch what unfolds in the coming days,” he added. At market open on July 29, sectoral indices on the NSE were trading mixed. The India VIX inched up 0.75 percent to 12.15, reflecting a slight uptick in volatility. Among gainers, Nifty Oil & Gas rose 0.52 percent, Nifty Metal added 0.33 percent, and Nifty Energy was up 0.22 percent. Nifty Infra and Realty also saw modest gains of 0.21 percent and 0.20 percent, respectively. On the flip side, Nifty IT slipped 0.46 percent, while Nifty Consumer Durables and Nifty Bank were down 0.18 percent and 0.12 percent, respectively. The broader markets showed mixed cues, with the Nifty Midcap 100 inching up 0.04 percent, while the Nifty Smallcap 100 declined 0.32 percent. Also read: Lenskart files draft paper with SEBI to raise funds via IPO From a stock's perspective, IndusInd Bank shares surged 2 percent after it reported better-than-expected results for the first quarter. The lender reported a 68 percent decline in standalone net profit at Rs 684 crore, hurt by a decline in loans and a rise in provisions for potential bad loans. On a consolidated basis, net profit fell 72 percent year-over-year to Rs 604 crore. Macquarie, Citi, and CLSA have dished out bearish calls on the stock. Shares of Bharat Electronics fell over 2  percent after its profit jumped 25 percent year-on-year, but witnessed a sequential decline. The state-run defence electronics firm reported a standalone net profit of Rs 969.13 crore for the quarter ended June 2025, up 25 percent from Rs 776.14 crore a year ago. CLSA has maintained its outperform call on the stock. Technical View The index has decisively broken down from its prolonged consolidation phase, violating multiple support levels and confirming a bearish shift in the near-term structure. If the Nifty breaches 24,650 on a closing basis, we may witness accelerated unwinding, pushing the index further down toward the 24,500–24,450 band. On the upside, the resistance zone has now migrated downward to 24,960–25,000, and any attempted relief rally toward this band may face renewed supply pressure. Until the index reclaims and sustains above 25,000, the broader bias will firmly remain negative, and rallies may be used to initiate fresh shorts rather than as signs of reversal The ongoing breakdown clearly signals a shift in sentiment, and it’s crucial for traders to remain aligned with the prevailing trend. JSW Steel, IndusInd Bank, Jio Financial Services, ONGC, and Tata Consumer Products were the top gainers on the Nifty. Laggards on the index included Bharat Electronics, Eternal, Infosys, Wipro, and SBI Life Insurance. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders shares fall 4.79% in early trade; stock among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150
content: Shares of Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders declined 4.79% to Rs 2,656.30 in early trade on Tuesday. The stock is among the top losers on the Nifty Midcap 150. In terms of quarterly performance, Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders has shown varying results. The revenue for the quarter-ending June 2025 stood at Rs 2,625.59 Crore, compared to Rs 3,174.41 Crore in the quarter-ending March 2025. The net profit for the June 2025 quarter was Rs 419.28 Crore, down from Rs 290.42 Crore in the previous quarter. Here's a detailed look at the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders:HeadingJun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025RevenueRs 2,357.02 CroreRs 2,756.83 CroreRs 3,143.62 CroreRs 3,174.41 CroreRs 2,625.59 CroreNet ProfitRs 665.94 CroreRs 552.76 CroreRs 768.22 CroreRs 290.42 CroreRs 419.28 CroreEPS34.5129.0120.018.0611.21The revenue saw an increase of 11.44% from June 2024 to June 2025, while net profit declined by 37.04% during the same period. Analyzing the yearly financials, the company's revenue for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 11,431.88 Crore, compared to Rs 9,466.58 Crore for the year-ending March 2024. The net profit for the year-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 2,277.34 Crore, up from Rs 1,808.88 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the year-ending March 2025 was Rs 59.83, compared to Rs 96.04 in the year-ending March 2024. The consolidated yearly financial performance is detailed below:Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 4,047.82 CroreRs 5,733.28 CroreRs 7,827.18 CroreRs 9,466.58 CroreRs 11,431.88 CroreNet ProfitRs 453.47 CroreRs 563.11 CroreRs 1,046.07 CroreRs 1,808.88 CroreRs 2,277.34 CroreEPS25.4830.2955.4896.0459.83BVPS170.15191.27236.02309.56196.83ROE14.9715.8323.5031.0230.39Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders announced on July 28, 2025, the approval of unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. Additionally, on June 27, 2025, the company announced the acquisition of a controlling stake in Colombo Dockyard PLC. The company had announced an interim dividend of Rs 3 per share (60%) on April 8, 2025, with an effective date of April 16, 2025. A stock split was announced on October 22, 2024, from a face value of Rs 10 to Rs 5, with an ex-split date of December 27, 2024. With the stock currently trading at Rs 2,656.30, Mazagon Dock Shipbuilders experiences downward movement amid bearish market sentiment.

title: Bharat Electronics shares fall 2.04% in early trade
content: Shares of Bharat Electronics declined by 2.04% to Rs 381.30 in Tuesday's early trading session. This decline positions the stock among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index. The company's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth. The annual revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at Rs 23,768.75 Crore, up from Rs 20,268.24 Crore in the previous year. Net profit also increased to Rs 5,287.15 Crore for the year ending March 2025, compared to Rs 3,943.11 Crore for the year ending March 2024. Earnings per share (EPS) rose to Rs 7.28 in March 2025, up from Rs 5.45 in March 2024. Here's a more detailed look at Bharat Electronics' key financial figures:Financial YearRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPS (Rs)BVPS (Rs)ROE (%)Debt to Equity202114,108.692,069.348.6245.4518.970.00202215,368.182,354.469.8550.4919.520.00202317,734.442,940.354.0918.9921.530.00202420,268.243,943.115.4522.3624.400.00202523,768.755,287.157.2827.3226.640.00The company's quarterly performance also reflects growth. For the quarter ending June 2025, the revenue stood at Rs 4,439.74 Crore, up from Rs 4,243.57 Crore in June 2024. The net profit for the same period was Rs 960.67 Crore, compared to Rs 780.99 Crore in the previous year.QuarterRevenue (Rs Crore)Net Profit (Rs Crore)EPSJun 20244,243.57780.991.08Sep 20244,604.901,083.881.50Dec 20245,770.691,301.271.79Mar 20259,149.592,121.012.91Jun 20254,439.74960.671.33Bharat Electronics has announced several corporate actions, including the appointment of a Cost Auditor and a Secretarial Auditor, as well as unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025. The company has also announced dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 1.50 per share (150%) was announced on March 5, 2025, with an effective date of March 11, 2025. Prior to this, a final dividend of Rs 0.80 per share (80%) was announced on May 21, 2024, with an effective date of August 14, 2024. Bharat Electronics announced a bonus issue on August 4, 2022, with a bonus ratio of 2:1 and an ex-bonus date of September 15, 2022. Additionally, the company had a stock split on January 27, 2017, where the old face value of Rs 10 was split to a new face value of Rs 1, with an ex-split date of March 16, 2017. Recent Moneycontrol analysis indicates a bearish sentiment on the stock.

title: Hindustan Unilever to announce quarterly results on July 31
content: The quarterly results for Hindustan Unilever are scheduled to be announced on July 31, according to an exchange filing. Financial Performance: Consolidated Quarterly Performance: The revenue for Hindustan Unilever has shown slight fluctuations over the last five quarters. For the quarter ending March 2024, the revenue was Rs 15,210.00 Crore, which increased to Rs 15,707.00 Crore by June 2024. It further rose to Rs 15,926.00 Crore in September 2024 before slightly decreasing to Rs 15,818.00 Crore in December 2024. The most recent quarter, ending March 2025, shows a revenue of Rs 15,670.00 Crore. Net profit followed a similar trend. It started at Rs 2,561.00 Crore in March 2024, increased to Rs 2,614.00 Crore by June 2024, and slightly decreased to Rs 2,601.00 Crore in September 2024. A notable increase was observed in December 2024, with a net profit of Rs 2,988.00 Crore, before falling to Rs 2,476.00 Crore in March 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) also varied, starting at Rs 10.89 in March 2024, rising to Rs 11.11 by June 2024, and then to Rs 11.03 in September 2024. The highest EPS was recorded in December 2024 at Rs 12.70, and it then decreased to Rs 10.48 in March 2025.HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 15,210.00 CroreRs 15,707.00 CroreRs 15,926.00 CroreRs 15,818.00 CroreRs 15,670.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 2,561.00 CroreRs 2,614.00 CroreRs 2,601.00 CroreRs 2,988.00 CroreRs 2,476.00 CroreEPS10.8911.1111.0312.7010.48Consolidated Yearly Performance: The annual revenue for Hindustan Unilever has consistently increased over the past five years. In 2021, the revenue stood at Rs 47,028.00 Crore, which grew to Rs 52,446.00 Crore in 2022, Rs 60,580.00 Crore in 2023, and Rs 61,896.00 Crore in 2024. The latest figure for 2025 shows a revenue of Rs 63,121.00 Crore. Net profit has also shown a steady increase. It was Rs 8,000.00 Crore in 2021, rising to Rs 8,887.00 Crore in 2022, Rs 10,145.00 Crore in 2023, and Rs 10,286.00 Crore in 2024. For 2025, the net profit is reported as Rs 10,679.00 Crore. Earnings per share (EPS) has followed a similar growth trajectory, increasing from Rs 34.03 in 2021 to Rs 37.79 in 2022, Rs 43.07 in 2023, and Rs 43.74 in 2024. The EPS for 2025 is Rs 45.32. Book Value Per Share (BVPS) has seen a fluctuating pattern, starting at Rs 202.95 in 2021, increasing to Rs 208.88 in 2022 and Rs 214.99 in 2023, and further to Rs 217.95 in 2024, before slightly decreasing to Rs 210.22 in 2025. Return on Equity (ROE) has shown consistent improvement, rising from 16.77% in 2021 to 18.09% in 2022, 20.11% in 2023, and 20.06% in 2024. The latest ROE for 2025 is 21.55%. The debt-to-equity ratio has remained stable at 0.00 across all five years, indicating that the company has not relied on debt financing during this period.Heading20212022202320242025RevenueRs 47,028.00 CroreRs 52,446.00 CroreRs 60,580.00 CroreRs 61,896.00 CroreRs 63,121.00 CroreNet ProfitRs 8,000.00 CroreRs 8,887.00 CroreRs 10,145.00 CroreRs 10,286.00 CroreRs 10,679.00 CroreEPS34.0337.7943.0743.7445.32BVPS202.95208.88214.99217.95210.22ROE16.7718.0920.1120.0621.55Debt to Equity0.000.000.000.000.00Hindustan Unilever’s sales for March 2025 stood at Rs 63,121 Crore compared to Rs 61,896 Crore in March 2024. Other income stood at Rs 1,017 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 811 Crore in March 2024. Total expenditure for the same period stood at Rs 49,320 Crore and Rs 48,443 Crore respectively. The company’s EBIT stood at Rs 14,818 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 14,264 Crore in March 2024. Corporate Actions Hindustan Unilever announced a final dividend of Rs 24 per share on April 24, 2025, with the ex-date as June 23, 2025. The company had also announced an interim dividend of Rs 19 per share and a special dividend of Rs 10 per share on October 10, 2024, with the ex-date as November 6, 2024. Additionally, the company has scheduled an earnings call, the intimation for which was announced on July 24, 2025. Hindustan Unilever is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index.

title: Bharti Airtel quarterly results to be announced on August 5
content: Bharti Airtel is scheduled to announce its quarterly results on August 5, 2025. In other news, on July 28, 2025, Bharti Airtel announced a partnership between Nxtra and AMPIN Energy Transition to augment green energy resources. This collaboration aims to secure an additional 205,167 MWh supply from ISTS solar-wind hybrid projects. title: Aurionpro Solutions Declares Interim Dividend of ₹1.00, Ex-Date Tomorrow
content: Aurionpro Solutions has announced an interim dividend of ₹1.00 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, July 30, 2025. The company's stock last traded at ₹1,348.20, reflecting a decrease of 3.45% compared to its previous close. This dividend comes amidst a backdrop of fluctuating market conditions and evolving financial performance for Aurionpro Solutions, a company with a market capitalization of ₹7443.89 Crore.Dividend DetailsThe interim dividend of ₹1.00 per share provides an immediate return to shareholders. The ex-date being set for tomorrow means that investors must own the shares by today to be eligible for the dividend. The specific payment date has not been disclosed.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹1.00Ex-DateJuly 30, 2025Payment DateNot DisclosedFinancial Performance OverviewAurionpro Solutions has demonstrated consistent growth in both revenue and net profit over the past few quarters. Consolidated revenue has increased steadily, reaching ₹336.82 crore in June 2025, up from ₹261.62 crore in June 2024. Similarly, net profit has risen from ₹44.60 crore to ₹50.64 crore over the same period. On a yearly basis, the company’s revenue has grown significantly from ₹374.02 crore in 2021 to ₹1,172.97 crore in 2025. Net profit has also seen a substantial turnaround, from a loss of ₹117.57 crore in 2021 to a profit of ₹188.43 crore in 2025. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) reflects this positive trend, increasing from -₹53.48 in 2021 to ₹34.72 in 2025.Key Financial Metrics (Consolidated)MetricJun 2025Mar 2025Dec 2024Sep 2024Jun 2024Revenue (₹ Cr)336.82326.95306.11278.28261.62Net Profit (₹ Cr)50.6450.5147.8145.5144.60EPS9.559.378.818.408.15Historical Context and Shareholder ImpactThe current dividend declaration continues Aurionpro’s trend of rewarding its shareholders. While a detailed comparison to previous interim dividends is not available, the consistency in dividend payouts underscores the company's commitment to returning value to its investors.Market ReactionDespite the dividend announcement, Aurionpro Solutions' stock experienced a decrease of 3.45%, with the last traded price at ₹1,348.20. This market reaction might be influenced by broader market trends or other company-specific factors beyond the dividend announcement. The stock’s performance will likely be closely monitored following the ex-date.

title: MM Forgings Announces Final Dividend of ₹4.00, Ex-Date Due Tomorrow
content: MM Forgings announced a final dividend of ₹4.00 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, July 30, 2025. The stock last traded at ₹350.45, reflecting a decrease of 2.77% compared to its previous close. The company's market capitalization stands at ₹1692.02 Crore. The dividend announcement provides an opportunity for investors to receive income from their investment in MM Forgings. The ex-date is a crucial date for shareholders, determining eligibility for the dividend payout. Shareholders who own the stock today will be eligible to receive the dividend. Today is the last day to buy or sell the stock before it trades ex-dividend.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹4.00Ex-DateJuly 30, 2025MM Forgings has demonstrated consistent financial performance over the past few years. The company's revenue has seen steady growth, with recent figures showing ₹1525.18 Crore for the year ending March 2025. However, this represents a slight decrease compared to the ₹1563.07 Crore reported for the year ending March 2024. Net profit for the year ending March 2025 stood at ₹121.86 Crore, down from ₹135.04 Crore in the previous year. The company's earnings per share (EPS) also decreased from ₹55.94 in March 2024 to ₹25.24 in March 2025. A closer look at the quarterly results reveals a revenue of ₹370.64 Crore for the quarter ending March 2025, compared to ₹397.49 Crore for the quarter ending March 2024. Net profit for the same period was ₹37.29 Crore, slightly higher than the ₹36.80 Crore reported in the previous year.Key Financial Metrics (Consolidated)MetricMar 2025Mar 2024Mar 2023Mar 2022Mar 2021Revenue (₹ Cr)1,525.181,563.071,461.881,139.63782.59Net Profit (₹ Cr)121.86135.04127.9491.0046.71EPS (₹)25.2455.9453.0037.6919.35Dividend/Share (₹)4.008.006.006.005.00The company's debt-to-equity ratio stands at 1.18 as of March 2025, slightly higher than the 1.03 reported in March 2024. The book value per share has decreased to ₹184.60 from ₹326.87 in the previous year. MM Forgings' announcement of a ₹4.00 dividend per share provides a tangible return to its shareholders, reflecting the company's commitment to delivering value. Investors will be closely watching the stock's performance following this announcement.

title: Hawkins Cooker announces final dividend of ₹130 per share, ex-date due tomorrow
content: Hawkins Cooker has announced a final dividend of ₹130 per share. The ex-date for this dividend is due tomorrow, July 30, 2025. This makes today the last day to buy or sell the stock before it trades ex-dividend. Shareholders who own the stock today will be eligible to receive the dividend. The announcement was made on May 28, 2025, and it represents a significant return to shareholders. The company's last traded price was Rs 9,312.15, reflecting a decrease of 1.05% from its previous closing price. The company has a market capitalization of 4924.09 Crores.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹130Ex-DateJuly 30, 2025Examining Hawkins Cooker's financial performance, the annual sales for March 2025 stood at 1115 Crores, compared to 1024 Crores in March 2024, showcasing an increase in revenue. The net profit for the same period was 114 Crores, up from 109 Crores the previous year. The total income for March 2025 was 1129 Crores, while the total expenditure amounted to 971 Crores. On a quarterly basis, the sales for March 2025 were 306 Crores, with a net profit of 34 Crores. These figures reflect consistent performance and profitability. The company's ability to maintain robust financials supports its dividend payout. The cash flow statement reveals that the cash flow from operating activities for March 2025 was 101 Crores. This indicates strong operational efficiency. The balance sheet shows that the total assets and total liabilities for March 2025 both amounted to 583 Crores, providing a snapshot of the company's financial stability. Analyzing the financial ratios, the Basic EPS (Earnings Per Share) for March 2025 was ₹216.90, compared to ₹207.72 in March 2024. The dividend per share has increased from ₹120 in March 2024 to ₹130 in March 2025. The Return on Networth / Equity (%) was 29.92% in March 2025. The dividend payout reflects the company’s strong financial health and commitment to rewarding its shareholders. The current ratio stands at 2.60, showcasing the company's liquidity. The debt to equity ratio is 0.06, indicating a low level of debt. The company’s financial ratios reflect its stability and growth potential, supporting its dividend strategy.

title: Rane Holdings announces final dividend of ₹38, ex-date due today
content: Rane Holdings has announced a final dividend of ₹38 per share, with the ex-date due today, July 29, 2025. The stock last traded at ₹1,587.30, marking a 1.31% increase compared to its previous closing price. This dividend announcement is likely to interest shareholders, offering them a return on their investment. The dividend payout of ₹38 per share is a significant distribution, reflecting the company's financial performance and commitment to rewarding its investors. The ex-date being today means that investors who owned the stock till yesterday will be eligible to receive this dividend. The stock will trade excluding the dividend value today onwards. Rane Holdings, with a market capitalization of 226.63 Crore, demonstrates a steady financial performance. A review of Rane Holdings' financial performance reveals the following: Financial Performance: The company's annual revenue has shown consistent growth over the past five years. In March 2025, the company reported revenue of ₹4,361.59 Crore, up from ₹3,529.82 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the same period increased significantly from ₹92.14 Crore to ₹185.59 Crore. The Earnings Per Share (EPS) also saw a substantial rise, increasing from ₹86.67 in 2024 to ₹145.13 in 2025. title: BASF Announces ₹20.00 Dividend, Ex-Date Due Tomorrow
content: BASF has announced a final dividend of ₹20.00 per share, with the ex-date due tomorrow, July 30, 2025. The company's shares last traded at ₹4,878.00, marking a decline of 3.31%. The announcement provides an opportunity for investors to receive dividend income. The ex-date determines the eligibility for receiving the dividend; shares purchased on or after this date will not be entitled to the dividend. From a financial standpoint, BASF has demonstrated substantial revenue and profitability. According to yearly data, the company's revenue for the year ending March 2025 stood at ₹15,260.00 Cr, compared to ₹13,767.48 Cr in March 2024. The net profit for the same period was ₹479.06 Cr, a decrease from ₹563.27 Cr in the previous year. Earnings per share (EPS) also saw a decrease, from ₹130.10 in 2024 to ₹110.70 in 2025. Quarterly performance data reveals that for the quarter ending March 2025, revenue was ₹3,286.71 Cr, and net profit was ₹27.01 Cr. These figures provide a snapshot of the company's recent financial activity. Additionally, BASF's market capitalization is approximately ₹21,114.74 Cr, underscoring its significant presence in the market. The dividend announcement is a part of the company's broader corporate action strategy.Dividend DetailsParticularsDetailsDividend per share₹20.00Ex-DateJuly 30, 2025BASF's financial performance over the past few years indicates fluctuating profitability alongside growing revenue. The yearly revenue has shown a consistent upward trend, from ₹1,054.47 Cr in 2008 to ₹15,260.00 Cr in 2025. However, net profit has seen some variability. In 2008, it stood at ₹57.46 Cr, increasing to ₹563.27 Cr by 2024, before decreasing to ₹479.06 Cr in 2025. Key financial ratios also provide insight into the company's operational efficiency. The Return on Equity (ROE) was 13.18% in 2025, compared to 17.47% in 2024. The Debt to Equity ratio remains low at 0.01 in 2025, indicating a conservative capital structure. The income statement data further illustrates BASF's financial activities. Annual sales for March 2025 were ₹15,162 Cr, with a total income of ₹15,242 Cr. Total expenditure amounted to ₹14,556 Cr, resulting in an EBIT of ₹685 Cr and a net profit of ₹499 Cr. These figures highlight the company's operational scale and profitability dynamics. Quarterly, the sales for March 2025 were ₹3,189 Cr, with a total income of ₹3,209 Cr. Total expenditure was ₹3,141 Cr, resulting in an EBIT of ₹67 Cr and a net profit of ₹47 Cr, showcasing the variability in quarterly performance. From a cash flow perspective, the cash flow from operating activities for the year ending March 2025 was ₹389 Cr. Investing activities resulted in a cash outflow of ₹111 Cr, while financing activities led to an outflow of ₹136 Cr, resulting in a net cash flow of ₹140 Cr. The balance sheet data reveals the financial structure of the company. As of March 2025, BASF had a share capital of ₹43 Cr, with reserves and surplus of ₹3,613 Cr. Total liabilities stood at ₹8,330 Cr, against total assets of ₹8,330 Cr. This gives a clear picture of the company's financial health. Key ratios further support the insights, with a basic EPS of ₹115.30 for March 2025 and a dividend per share of ₹20.00. The book value per share was ₹844.79, and the face value remained at ₹10.

title: IndusInd Bank shares rise 2% after Q1; should you buy, sell or hold?
content: Shares of private lender IndusInd Bank gained as much as 2 percent to Rs 819 after it reported better-than-expected results for the first quarter. The lender reported a 68 percent decline in standalone net profit at Rs 684 crore, hurt by a decline in loans and a rise in provisions for potential bad loans. On a consolidated basis, net profit fell 72 percent year-over-year to Rs 604 crore. The lender's net interest income fell 14 percent year-on-year to Rs 4,640 crore in Q1FY26. According to Moneycontrol's poll, IndusInd Bank's net interest income (NII) was seen at Rs 4,279 crore in Q1FY26 and profit was pegged at Rs 559 crore in Q1FY26. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates Should you buy, sell or hold the IndusInd Bank stock? Macquarie has an underperform call with a target of Rs 650, implying a downside potential of 19 percent from the last close on the NSE. Its Q1 profit was in line with expectations, supported by higher NIMs and treasury gains, but these were offset by weak fee income. Elevated slippages led to higher credit costs, and the brokerage expects return on assets (RoAs) to stay below 1 percent in the near term. CITI has a sell rating and a target price of Rs 765. The brokerage said Q1 results pointed to a gradual reset in key levers such as NIM, fee income, and credit costs. While legacy issues didn’t reappear, fee-to-assets dropped to 1.2 percent, and credit costs stayed high at 2 percent. Slippages in the MFI portfolio nearly halved, but stress in vehicle finance and broader retail led to overall slippages of 3 percent. GNPAs rose across segments, though core NIM at 3.35 percent was a positive surprise. CITI believes improvement depends on stabilising NIMs, growing fees, cutting costs, and lowering credit costs. CLSA has a hold call with a target of Rs 725. The international brokerage noted that management is focused on stabilising the business, and the board has submitted MD & CEO nominations to the RBI. Loans and deposits both fell 3 percent quarter-on-quarter, mainly due to weakness in the wholesale segment. Core NIM declined by 12 basis points QoQ, in line with trends seen in other large private lenders. Bernstein is outperforming on the stock with a target price of Rs 1,000. It noted that Q1 results showed no impact from previous clean-up efforts, but persistent issues remain, including asset quality deterioration, weak fee income, and subdued NIMs. Bernstein flagged the lack of clear levers to improve RoA in the near term, which may prompt a reassessment of the bank’s profitability outlook. During the quarter, the Bank’s Total Capital Adequacy Ratio as per Basel III guidelines (excluding Q1 profits) stands at 16.63 percent as on June 30, 2025, as compared to 17.04 percent as on June 30, 2024. IndusInd Bank shares have fallen 17 percent since the beginning of the year. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Kotak Mahindra shares fall 7.44% on Monday; among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Kotak Mahindra declined sharply in yesterday's trade, with the stock among the top losers on the Nifty 50. At the close of trading on Monday, the stock was at Rs 1,966.60 on the NSE, a 7.44% fall. Financial Performance: Kotak Mahindra's consolidated financial performance shows consistent growth in revenue and net profit over the past five years. Net profit also saw a significant rise from Rs 9,903 Crore in 2021 to Rs 21,946 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) have risen from Rs 50.53 in 2021 to Rs 111.29 in 2025. For the quarter-ending June 2025, net profit was Rs 4,429 Crore, down from Rs 7,399 Crore in the previous year. The EPS for the quarter-ending June 2025 was Rs 22.49, compared to Rs 37.47 in June 2024. Key financial figures are summarized below:Particulars (Consolidated)Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025Jun 2025Net ProfitRs 7,399 CroreRs 4,997 CroreRs 4,639 CroreRs 4,908 CroreRs 4,429 CroreEPS37.4725.3723.6424.8122.49 Particulars (Consolidated)20212022202320242025Net ProfitRs 9,903 CroreRs 11,932 CroreRs 14,780 CroreRs 17,977 CroreRs 21,946 CroreEPS50.5360.7674.9691.45111.29BVPS425.56487.06562.86653.81792.11ROE11.8412.5013.3414.0114.04NIM4.144.054.474.384.25Income Statement: The annual income statement shows consistent growth in interest earned, which is the primary source of revenue. Total income has increased from Rs 56,814 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 106,902 Crore in March 2025. Total expenditure has also increased, but operating profit has remained strong. The net profit has increased from Rs 9,903 crore in March 2021 to Rs 21,946 crore in March 2025. The quarterly income statement also reflects these trends with Interest Earned increasing from Rs 15,836 crore in June 2024 to Rs 17,248 crore in June 2025. Total expenditure has increased from Rs 18,293 crore to Rs 19,329 crore for the same period. Balance Sheet: The consolidated balance sheet shows an increase in deposits from Rs 278,871 Crore in March 2021 to Rs 494,707 Crore in March 2025. Loans and advances have also increased from Rs 252,188 Crore to Rs 486,165 Crore during the same period. Total Assets stood at Rs 879,774 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 478,872 Crore in March 2021. The capital adequacy ratio has remained above 20% for all the years. Cash Flow: The cash flow statement indicates that net cash flow from operating activities was Rs 16,915 Crore in March 2025 compared to Rs 4,881 Crore in March 2021. Corporate Actions: The company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (50%) on May 5, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025. Other corporate actions include newspaper publications related to the unaudited financial results for the quarter ended June 30, 2025 and audio recordings of earnings conference calls. Key Ratios: Basic EPS stood at Rs 111.29 in March 2025. The Net Interest Margin (NIM) was 4.25% and Return on Networth/Equity was 14.04% in March 2025. The P/E ratio was 19.51 and P/B was 2.74 as of March 2025. Moneycontrol analysis, as of July 25, 2025, suggests a bearish sentiment on the stock. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 2.50 per share (50%) on May 5, 2025, with an effective date of July 18, 2025.

title: Wipro share price falls 3.53% on Monday, stock among top losers on Nifty 50
content: Shares of Wipro ended down by 3.53% at Rs 250.05 on Monday, placing it among the top losers on the Nifty 50 index in yesterday's session. Wipro's consolidated financial performance offers key insights. The company's revenue for the quarter ending June 2025 stood at Rs 22,134.60 Crore, compared to Rs 21,963.80 Crore in June 2024, representing an increase of 0.78%. The net profit for the same quarter was Rs 3,331.50 Crore, up 9.55% from Rs 3,041.10 Crore year-over-year. However, the Earnings Per Share (EPS) for June 2025 was Rs 3.18, down from Rs 5.75 in June 2024. Analyzing the annual consolidated data, Wipro's revenue for the year ending March 2025 was Rs 89,088.40 Crore, a marginal decrease of 0.75% compared to Rs 89,760.30 Crore recorded in March 2024. Net profit increased significantly by 18.47% to Rs 13,192.60 Crore in March 2025, compared to Rs 11,135.40 Crore in the previous year. The annual EPS, however, decreased to Rs 12.56 in March 2025 from Rs 20.89 in March 2024.Financial YearRevenue (Rs. Crore)Net Profit (Rs. title: Varun Beverages shares gain 2% on Monday, among top gainers on Nifty Next 50
content: Shares of Varun Beverages closed among the top gainers on the Nifty Next 50 on Monday. At yesterday's close, the stock was at Rs 486.75, a 2.01% increase. Varun Beverages Ltd has scheduled a board meeting on July 29, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited financial results for the quarter and half year ended June 30, 2025. The board will also consider the declaration of the second interim dividend for the financial year 2025. The trading window, which has been closed since July 1, 2025, will remain closed until July 31, 2025. In corporate actions, the company announced a bonus issue on April 28, 2022, with an existing ratio of 2:1 and an ex-bonus date of June 6, 2022. Prior to this, bonus issues were announced on May 3, 2021, and June 17, 2019, both with the same 2:1 ratio. The company also executed stock splits, with announcements made on July 30, 2024, and May 2, 2023. The company has announced several dividends. An interim dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (25%) was announced on April 30, 2025, and a final dividend of Rs 0.50 per share (25%) was announced on February 10, 2025. Financial Performance: The following table summarizes the consolidated quarterly financial performance of Varun Beverages:HeadingMar 2024Jun 2024Sep 2024Dec 2024Mar 2025RevenueRs 4,317.31 CroreRs 7,196.86 CroreRs 4,804.68 CroreRs 3,688.79 CroreRs 5,566.94 CroreNet ProfitRs 548.14 CroreRs 1,262.37 CroreRs 628.92 CroreRs 196.33 CroreRs 731.94 CroreEPS4.149.641.910.562.15The company’s revenue for the quarter-ending March 2025 stood at Rs 5,566.94 Crore, compared to Rs 4,317.31 Crore in March 2024. The net profit for the quarter-ending March 2025 was Rs 731.94 Crore, up from Rs 548.14 Crore in the same quarter last year. The EPS for the quarter-ending March 2025 was 2.15, compared to 4.14 in March 2024. title: Hero Motocorp shares rise 1.4% on Monday, among top gainers on Nifty 50
content: Hero Motocorp shares saw an increase of 1.43% in yesterday's trade, with the stock ending at Rs 4,291.10. The stock was identified as one of the top gainers on the Nifty 50 in Monday's trading session. Hero Motocorp is included as one of the stocks in the benchmark Nifty 50 index.Financial YearRevenue (Rs. Crore)Net Profit (Rs. Crore)EPS (Rs.)202130,959.192,982.61146.07202229,551.282,528.10115.96202334,158.382,796.79140.62202437,788.623,862.41187.36202540,923.424,536.93218.96The company has demonstrated consistent growth in key financial metrics over the past five years. Revenue has increased from Rs 30,959.19 Crore in 2021 to Rs 40,923.42 Crore in 2025. Net profit has also risen from Rs 2,982.61 Crore in 2021 to Rs 4,536.93 Crore in 2025. Earnings per share (EPS) have grown from Rs 146.07 in 2021 to Rs 218.96 in 2025.QuarterRevenue (Rs. Crore)Net Profit (Rs. Crore)EPS (Rs.)Mar 20249,616.681,018.0346.78Jun 202410,210.791,086.3552.31Sep 202410,482.931,152.7553.19Dec 202410,259.891,200.1255.38Mar 20259,969.811,097.7158.08The consolidated quarterly results show a fluctuating trend in revenue and net profit. Revenue for the quarter-ending March 2024 was Rs 9,616.68 Crore, which increased to Rs 10,210.79 Crore for the quarter-ending June 2024, and further to Rs 10,482.93 Crore for the quarter-ending September 2024. It slightly decreased to Rs 10,259.89 Crore for the quarter-ending December 2024 and ended at Rs 9,969.81 Crore for the quarter-ending March 2025. Net profit also experienced a similar trend, starting at Rs 1,018.03 Crore in March 2024, peaking at Rs 1,200.12 Crore in December 2024, and settling at Rs 1,097.71 Crore in March 2025. The EPS saw a steady increase from Rs 46.78 in March 2024 to Rs 58.08 in March 2025. Hero Motocorp Ltd has announced that a meeting of the Board of Directors is scheduled on August 6, 2025, to consider and approve the unaudited standalone and consolidated financial results for the quarter ended on June 30, 2025. An earnings conference call with analysts / investors is planned for August 7, 2025. The company announced a final dividend of Rs 65 per share (3250%) with an effective date of July 24, 2025. Prior to this, an interim dividend of Rs 100 per share (5000%) was declared, effective from February 12, 2025. In summary, Hero Motocorp's stock showed positive movement in yesterday's trading. The company’s financial performance indicates consistent growth, although quarterly results show some fluctuation. Upcoming board meetings and recent dividend announcements may influence investor sentiment.

title: Lodha Developers shares fall 5.96% on Monday; among top losers on Nifty Next 50

title: Sensex, Nifty set for weak open amid mixed global cues; key levels to track on July 29
content: Sensex and Nifty are set to extend their losing streak on July 29, as global jitters and disappointing earnings weigh on sentiment. US markets ended mixed after a strong start, while Asian peers slipped. The GIFT Nifty was down 40 points at 24,665 around 7:45 pm, signalling a weak open. Bears dragged Dalal Street deep into the red, while selling pressure in key financial stocks also contributed to heavy losses in the Nifty 50 and Sensex indices, on Friday, July 25. All sectoral indices, barring pharma and healthcare, sank deep into the red. Follow our LIVE blog for all the latest market updates On July 28, Foreign Portfolio Investors (FPIs) were net sellers to the tune of Rs 6,082 crore worth of shares in Indian equities, while domestic institutional investors (DIIs) net bought Rs 6765 crore worth of shares, according to provisional NSE data. This is the highest net selling by FIIs since May 30 and the highest net buying by DIIs since June 17. Here are the key levels to watch out for in today's session The index has decisively broken down from its prolonged consolidation phase, violating multiple support levels and confirming a bearish shift in the near-term structure. If the Nifty breaches 24,650 on a closing basis, we may witness accelerated unwinding, pushing the index further down toward the 24,500–24,450 band. On the upside, the resistance zone has now migrated downward to 24,960–25,000, and any attempted relief rally toward this band may face renewed supply pressure. Until the index reclaims and sustains above 25,000, the broader bias will firmly remain negative, and rallies may be used to initiate fresh shorts rather than as signs of reversal The ongoing breakdown clearly signals a shift in sentiment, and it’s crucial for traders to remain aligned with the prevailing trend. "The current week brings elevated event-risk with the FOMC meeting and updates on US trade tariff policies looming large. Against this backdrop, the index decisively slipped below its 50-Day exponential moving average, currently anchored near 56,110, which had repeatedly served as a key cushion in recent declines—its violation has further aggravated market jitters. A decisive break and close beneath the 56,000 handle would likely escalate selling intensity, potentially dragging the benchmark toward the 55,500–55,450 zone in the short run," Dhupesh Dhameja of SAMCO Securities said. The India VIX spiked by 6.98 percent, closing at 12.06, continuing its upward journey for the second straight session—marking a cumulative 11 percent rise in just two days. This suggests that participants are bracing for heightened volatility in light of key global cues. That said, VIX remains below the 13 mark, indicating that long-term investors are not exiting en masse. The Put-Call Ratio (PCR) slipped further from 0.65 to 0.59, reflecting increased call exposure and a tilt in favor of bears. However, the falling PCR is approaching oversold territory, warranting close observation as it may signal short-term exhaustion. This reallocation of positioning by both option writers suggests that traders are bracing for additional downside but are also staying agile amid an event-driven week. Disclaimer: The views and investment tips expressed by investment experts on Moneycontrol.com are their own and not those of the website or its management. Moneycontrol.com advises users to check with certified experts before taking any investment decisions.

title: Suzlon Energy shares fall 4.35% on Monday, among top losers on Nifty Midcap 150

title: PNC Infratech share price gain 3% on order win worth Rs 2,957cr
content: PNC Infratech share price rose 3 percent in the opening trade on July 29 after the company bagged an order worth Rs 2,957 crore from South Eastern Coalfields. At 09:18am, PNC Infratech was quoting at Rs 308.15, up Rs 9.70, or 3.25 percent on the BSE "..... has emerged as first lowest bidder in a tender floated by South Eastern Coalfields for handling, transport and other mining services - hiring of HEMM for OB removal and coal extraction by surface miner and loading and transportation of extracted coal to different destinations at Gevra OCP expansion project in the state of Chhattisgarh for a quoted amount of Rs 2,956,65,99,9091. Catch all the market action on our live blog On July 16, the company emerged as lowest bidders by NHPC for setting up of 1200 MW ISTS (Inter State Transmission System) connected solar power projects with 600MW2400MWh Energy Storage Systems (ESS) on anywhere in India basis at a quoted price of Rs 3.13/kwh. In the previous trading session, the share closed at Rs 298.45, down Rs 5.40, or 1.78 percent. The share touched a 52-week high of Rs 518.05 and a 52-week low of Rs 235.70 on 12 August, 2024 and 07 April, 2025, respectively. Currently, the stock is trading 40.52 percent below its 52-week high and 30.74 percent above its 52-week low. The market capitalisation of the company stands at Rs 7,905.25 crore.

title: First Tick: Here are the top global cues for today’s trade
content: Indian benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty are likely to see a negative opening on July 29, tracking cues from GIFT Nifty was trading around 24,675 a short while ago this morning. Track the latest updates on GIFT Nifty right here on Moneycontrol. Indian benchmark indices start the week on a negative note, ending lower on the third consecutive session on July 28, with Nifty falling below 24,700 for the first time since June 13. At close, the Sensex was down 572.07 points or 0.70 percent at 80,891.02, and the Nifty was down 156.10 points or 0.63 percent at 24,680.90. The BSE Midcap index shed 0.7 percent, and the smallcap index fell 1.3 percent. Here is how financial markets across the globe fared overnight: GIFT Nifty (Down) The GIFT Nifty is trading marginally lower at around 24,675, indicating a flat to negative start for the day. Asian Equities (Down) Asian stocks slipped after a flat session on Wall Street, as investors stayed cautious amid a week packed with economic data and corporate earnings.  US Equities (Mixed) The S&P 500 edged higher to eke out a record high close for a sixth straight session on Monday, while the Nasdaq also advanced to a closing record in choppy trade as investors gauged the U.S.-EU trade pact and prepared for a week of major market catalysts. The Dow Jones Industrial Average fell 64.36 points, or 0.14%, to 44,837.56, the S&P 500 gained 1.13 points, or 0.02%, to 6,389.77, and the Nasdaq Composite gained 70.27 points, or 0.33%, to 21,178.58.  US Bond Yield (Down) The yield on 10-year Treasuries and 2-year Treasuries were trading marginally lower at 4.4 percent and 3.9 percent, respectively, in the early trade on Tuesday.  Dollar Index (Up) The dollar steadied on Tuesday after climbing the most since May in the prior session.  Asian currencies (Down) All the Asian currencies were trading lower in the early trade on Tuesday, with the Indonesian Rupiah leading the losers, followed by the Philippines Peso, China Renminbi, Malaysian Ringgit, and South Korean Won.  Crude (UP) Oil extended gains on Tuesday, lifted by hopes of improved economic activity after the U.S.-EU trade deal, a potential U.S.-China tariff truce, and President Donald Trump's shorter deadline for Russia to end the Ukraine war.  Gold (Down) Gold held a decline after the dollar rose the most since May following a tariff deal between the US and the European Union, with investors now focusing on prospects for an extension of a trade truce between Washington and Beijing.  Fund Flow Action The selling from Foreign institutional investors (FIIs) extended for the sixth day as they sold equities worth Rs 6,082 crore on July 28, while Domestic institutional investors (DIIs) bought equities worth Rs 6,764 crore on the same day.  Hope you're all set for today's trade. We wish you a profitable day ahead.
